getCoercableParameter

public double getCoercableParameter()
Description copied from interface: CoercableMCMCOperator
A coercable parameter must have a range from -infinity to +infinity with a preference for small numbers.

If operator acceptance is too high, BEAST increases the parameter; if operator acceptance is too low, BEAST decreases the parameter.

From MarkovChain.coerceAcceptanceProbability:

new parameter = old parameter + 1/(1+N) * (current-step acceptance probability - target probabilitity),

where N is some function of the number of operator trials.

Returns:
a "coercable" parameter

setCoercableParameter

public void setCoercableParameter(double value)
Description copied from interface: CoercableMCMCOperator
Sets the coercable parameter value. A coercable parameter must have a range from -infinity to +infinity with a preference for small numbers.

Parameters:
value - the value to set the coercible parameter to
